metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3421 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the RPM package in the read functionality. This flawallows an attacker who can convince a victim to install a seeminglyverifiable package or compromise an RPM repository, to cause RPM databasecorruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to dataintegrity. This flaw affects RPM versions before 4.17.0-alpha.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librpm9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmbuild9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmio9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
librpmsign9 - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
python3-rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-common - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm-i18n - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
rpm2cpio - 4.17.0+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rpm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.17.0+dfsg1-1').
